radiographic_examinations.findings: The gallbladder is distended with numerous gallstones identified. The gallbladder wall is edematous measuring up to 7 mm with hyperemia post-contrast but is intact. Mild surrounding pericholecystic stranding and free fluid consistent with acute cholecystitis. No intrahepatic biliary dilatation or filling defects in the common bile duct. The pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands, and kidneys are unremarkable with no evidence of complications.
